intro: Chamaeraphis compressa, commonly known as sea barleygrass, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant has narrow, blade-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of salt-tolerant hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, typical of many grass species. Chamaeraphis compressa is adapted to saline and sandy environments, making it an important plant in coastal ecosystems.
